bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.ab:
Consulate-General, U. S. A.,
Monrovia, Liberia, December 31, 1892

Mr William D. McCoy,
To the Department of State.

Consulate-General, U. S. A.,
Monrovia, Liberia, December 31, 1892

Honorable William F. Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
WASHINGTON, D. C.
div1.p: I have the honor of presenting the inclosed Reports for the Quarter ending this date.

I am, sir–
Your obedient servant,

William D. McCoy,
U.S. Minister-Resident and Consul-General.

1. Summary of Business for the Quarter.
2. Digest of the Invoice Book.
3. Arrivals and Departures of Vessels.
4. Record of Notarial Services.
5. Record of Treasury Fees received.
6. Record of Bills of Health issued.
7. Salary Account.
8. Contingent Expense Account.
9. Register of Official Letters for the Quarter.
10. " " " " " " Year.
11. Abstract of Contingent Expenses.
12. Vouchers for Expenditures.
